title: Thursday, 25th January, 2018
bodyHTML:
Blank canvas good morning all
11:01 am
BE11:01am

Hey, hello, hi, good morning, welcome to Markets Live.

MG goodmorning
Alchemy30 Morning, news overload !
Grouchmonkey Morning
Nately Ahoy
BE11:02am

The "how on earth is it only Thursday" session.

Soundbuy Morning
DM11:02am

It's we get cake to get us over the hump day

11:03 am
BE11:03am

Indeed! Much to the amusement of other media.

BE11:03am

So .... I've not had time found a picture to begin, so instead here's a bit of culture.

BE11:03am

Apropos of it being Burns Night, so indulge me for a moment.

ValencianBull morning
11:03 am
BE11:03am

Here's Lines Written On A Banknote:

BE11:03am

Wae worth thy power, thou cursed leaf!
Fell source o' a' my woe and grief!
For lack o' thee I've lost my lass!
For lack o' thee I scrimp my glass!
I see the children of affliction
Unaided, through thy curst restriction:
I've seen the oppressor's cruel smile
Amid his hapless victim's spoil;
And for thy potence vainly wished,
To crush the villain in the dust:
For lack o' thee, I leave this much-lov'd shore,
Never, perhaps, to greet old Scotland more.

BE11:04am

And, inevitably, the session will go downhill from there.

11:03 am
undefined
BE11:04am

So ............. Reasonable amount of corporate to get through.

DM11:04am

numbers numbers numbers

11:04 am
DM11:04am

which should we start with?

BE11:04am

Happy to take requests from the right.

Grouchmonkey Kier is the obvious
BE11:05am

I guess we can start with the ones that are going badly, as is tradition.

11:05 am
Renishaw PLC (RSW:LSE): Last: 5,090, down 550 (-9.75%), High: 5,585, Low: 5,005, Volume: 125.12k
Pseudonym Can we just confirm that there are women here? I wouldn't want to be present at a male only event.
MG LOL
Miss Piggy Pseudo: the hostesses were women
Forester For lack o' thee I've lost my lass!For lack o' thee I scrimp my glass!Burns spot on for my life!
BE11:06am

And in terms of numbers it's not that bad.

BE11:06am

What it isn't is a repeat of Q1, which was exceptionally good.

Otter Hello brave internet friends. Today I have used two sachets of instant porridge in a single bowl.
Mouselet Good morning miscellaneous and assorted people
11:07 am
BE11:07am

And it somewhat undermines the idea that Renishaw will have any kind of reliability or visibility ......

Mouselet Today I have had lemsip and a honey and a marmite sandwich
#REF! Hello all. Was about to ask for RSW. Beat me to it. PRSM as well please if not too cheeky.
BE11:07am

Here's UBS.

BE11:08am

A: H1 sales were +20% at constant exchange rates to £280m, continuing the growth rate of Q1. PBT was £62m, well below our forecast of £74m. This implies Q2 PBT at £26.5m declining vs Q1 £35.8m highlighting continued quarterly volatility.

11:08 am
BE11:08am

Q: What were the most noteworthy areas in the results?
A: Metrology posted 18% Y/Y growth with "particularly strong" growth in additive manufacturing highlighted. However, there is no commentary on large orders which were cited as a benefit at Q1 (and these tend to be a major factor in profit volatility).

Otter Renishaw IR refuses to speak with investors on the telephone.
BE11:08am

Q: Has the company's outlook/guidance changed?
A: FY guidance provided: Sales range of £575-605m, adjusted PBT £127-147m. Versus consensus of £598m and £141m, UBSe £627m and £142m.

Q: How would we expect investors to react?
A: Guidance supports consensus, but offers limited upside potential. We would note that the sector P/E premium at greater than 60% is well above its average (c40%) and with limited incremental EPS momentum we retain a Sell rating.

DM11:08am

is the switching chairs interesting?

Cavendish Square I suspect the Renishaw price drop could be a bit of profit taking
Mouselet It's gone up 2.5x in the last year!
Bonnemort @Mouselet - honey and marmite top combination, esp on toast
Flaneur Its also some sort of Valentines day in Wales... or so twitter tells me.
11:09 am
DM11:09am

group sales and marketing director William Lee over to the bigger leather backed one in the middle

PeterC Morning, Any comment on Blue Prism FY (PRSM.L) ? Thanks
BE11:09am

Um ... it's a little difficult to say.

DM11:09am

Founder Sir David McMurty off

11:10 am
BE11:10am

As Otter notes, Renishaw management has a reputation for being standoffish. Their investor communications are not widely praised.

Flaneur Unless 'Dwynwens Day' is a footballer being transferred... Thats what my twitter is usually full of. That and the names of horses which have won races.
BE11:11am

Because of that, expectations can get ahead of themselves both on the upside and the downside.

Lefevre Not a Burns scholar but "For lack o' thee I've lost my lass!For lack o' thee I scrimp my glass!" - presumably no QE back then, couldn't say that now
popeye Good morning - any grey on the boringly reliable St James Pl - SJP appreciated, ta
BE11:11am

Lately, because there's been some iPhone hype -- https://www.bloomb...-iphone-connection -- expectations have been rather toppy.

Mouselet Why Blue Prism? It hasn't moved very far, and 'operating system for the digital workforce' sounds like bafflegab
11:11 am
BE11:12am

Let me get Stifel.

#REF! @Otter basically impossible to find IR or PR details on Renishaw website... very very odd
BE11:13am

...... Damn. Stifel not opening. Have Barclays instead.

BE11:13am

Notwithstanding another strong set of results, albeit slightly shy of our demanding expectations (and we concede a high margin of error here due to Renishaw’s high operational gearing), Renishaw’s current valuation (EV/sales of 6.9x and PER of 34.2x of FY19E estimates) brings its own demands, which we feel today’s numbers and outlook (the mid point of the range of which is broadly in line with our current and Thomson Reuters consensus expectations), at first glance, fall shy of.

11:13 am
BE11:13am

And Stifel, finally .....

#REF! @Mouselet I'm always fascinated by what analysts say on something like a PRSM. It's basically momentum based on hype (whether justified or not). What can one analyse in that case.
Mouselet grr, another British tech company with high operational gearing
Mouselet I think of unanalysable companies as a separate investment universe
BE11:14am

We have looked again at our Renishaw forecasts ahead of interim results this Thursday (25th). Given the very strong 1Q update, and continuing robust data on the global manufacturing economy, we have concluded that our numbers looked overly conservative. We are raising 2018E EPS by around 10%, towards the top of a broad range. Even on higher numbers, however, valuations continue to look excessive to us at 34X 2018E earnings and over 7X sales. In our view, Renishaw is a remarkable company, operating in strong markets currently - but revenue trends are volatile, and may have reached a short term peak in Asian consumer electronics related orders, while FX is rapidly moving from tailwind to headwind. Lack of disclosure, and uncertainty over succession planning also argue for some caution. We retain our sell rating on a 12 month view, but would not be surprised to see further near term strength through the 1H report. TP raised from 4200p to 4500p on forecast increases.

BE11:14am

In terms of the management churn ......

Grouchmonkey Another vote for SJP. 20% increase in AUM seems worth a bit better than a small drop in the price
RA Ahh the motley crowd. good morning
mojomogoz All very well bashing good sensible companies like Renishaw but could someone please explain why Blue Prism isn't just preposterous please.
11:14 am
BE11:15am

UBS is unfussed.

Mouselet Kier looking respectably bounce post-Carillion
RA bit late today, looking at how the ECB could affect me today
BE11:15am

Renishaw has announced that Sir David McMurtry will be handing over his Chief Executive duties, but will remain as Executive Chairman with responsibility for group innovation and product strategy. William Lee, currently a member of the executive board and Group Sales & Marketing Director, will take over the CEO responsibilities. William Lee has been with the group since 1997 and a member of the board since 2016. The change will be effective from 1 February. We see this change as evolution, with Sir David continuing to exercise significant control over the group direction as Executive Chairman. Such a change in responsibilities has been likely in our opinion at some point since the retirement in 2016 of Assistant Chief Executive Ben Taylor.

BE11:15am

And I think that covers Renishaw.

DM11:25am

Q1/18 is ahead of plan and so our revenue forecasts are revised upwards, with
details overleaf, including higher EBITDA losses in the short to mid-term for
investment related to the announced placing. Momentum is well split between
new business and upsell activity. The latter is worth highlighting, with c.131
customers buying 264 upsells (i.e. c.2x upsells per year each on average) in
FY17, compared with a total customer base of c.153 at the start of FY17. This
points to a material “land and expand” opportunity already established.

red Imperial Brands a keeper in 25-28 quid zone imo. Buy and forget (dont to reinvest proceeds) for 10 years.

DM11:26am

The c.£40m primary placing will fuel further S&M headcount addition as part of
hiring across the business. Essentially, the case for this investment is the same as
it was at IPO, just at higher scale. The business remains less limited by demand
than by capacity to scale. We see this move as a demonstration of confidence that
annualised revenues could ultimately be scaled past the £100m mark.

BE11:30am

We update our forecasts on S&N to take account of two key tailwinds to reported numbers - FX and tax rates, which combined add c10% to our $ EPS forecasts. The £ share price has pulled back c13% since the activist shareholder induced highs in November. While sterling strength is partly to blame, there has still been a significant de-rating, with the shares now trading on FY19 PER of 16.6x. With a relatively unlevered balance sheet (0.6x EBITDA) giving flexibility (most likely M&A, but possibly a share buyback), a new cost savings programme (to be announced at FY results) and a new CEO TBC, we see the valuation as attractive, coupled with catalysts. With limited attractive growth opportunities elsewhere in UK healthcare, we upgrade to Overweight (previously Neutral).

11:31 am
BE11:31am

So, tax thing. And FX thing. Meaning ....

BE11:31am

Our FY19 forecasts are now c2% ahead at the revenue line and c8% at the EPS line. On our forecasts, the shares are now trading at FY19 PER of 16.6x vs Stryker on 20.7x and Zimmer Biomet on 14.1x. The PE relative to the UK market and EU healthcare sector is at or near multi-year lows.

PeterC @Xanthine :-) awful lot of guff,. Still, skepticism is good to hear.

Kepler:

BE11:58am

Diageo reported better-than-expected H1 organic revenue and profit growth. Marketing costs increased by 7% organically, but this was more than offset by productivity savings. EPS came in 3.5% ahead of consensus. Reported results include a GBP360m exceptional tax credit in the US.

Miss Piggy @rw42: time to join the Tory party and get a vote?
BE11:58am

Organic revenue growth in North America was 2.4% and organic operating profit growth was 2.6%, slightly ahead of our forecast. US spirits growth of 3% is slightly soft. Vodka continues to be a headwind (-2% organic revenue growth Smirnoff, double-digit decline Ciroc and Ketel One), while Johnnie Walker and Bulleit were strong (both 9%) and Crown Royal decent (3%).

BE11:58am

Diageo said that financial expectations for 2017/18 remain unchanged, which implies an acceleration of growth in H2. The FY 2017/18 tax rate will be a bit lower than previous guidance. Adverse currency moves are expected to result in a negative impact on operating profit of GBP60m compared to previous guidance for a GBP70m positive impact.

BE11:59am

We expect FY 2017/18 consensus to remain unchanged as better H1 results are offset by the negative FX effect. Our TP of 2550p is based on a DCF model (7.6% WACC, 2.5% perpetual growth, 33.4% terminal year operating margin) and a relative multiples analysis.

And SocGen.

BE11:59am

Today’s beat in both sales and EPS will be welcomed by the market in our view. The biggest surprise is the result in AsiaPac at more than double the consensus organic growth rate, as well as continued strong growth in Europe. But the slight miss in North America takes some of the shine off – mainly due to the lapping of Crown Royal Vanilla’s launch last year, meaning this brand was only up 3% in the half, down from double digit growth last year. New tax guidance on the back of tax changes raised reported EPS by about 2%.
